nodes.documentation:
@notice AuthChecker performs authorization checks on function calls. Authorization checks are
returned as the result of `canCall` of the configured Guard implementation.
nodes.name: AuthChecker
SetGuard

nodes.documentation:
@dev Modify the function so that it will revert if the caller is not auhorized to call the
function in the current context (this contract).
nodes.name: onlyAuthorized
setGuard
isAuthorized

nodes.documentation:
@notice AuthChecker performs authorization checks on function calls. Authorization checks are
returned as the result of `canCall` of the configured Guard implementation.
nodes.name: AuthChecker
SetGuard

nodes.documentation:
@dev Modify the function so that it will revert if the caller is not auhorized to call the
function in the current context (this contract).
nodes.name: onlyAuthorized
setGuard
isAuthorized

constructor.details: Constructor should be provided with an address of a guard implementaion. If null, the ACL denies all permissions to callers outside the contract.

params._guard: - An address of an IGuard implementation.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).details: The check performed by calling `canCall` on the Guard instance. If no Guard instance is configured, function returns false (as a failsafe).

params._sig: The function selector of the function being called.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).return: True, if the caller is authorized to make the call.

params._guard: The address of the new Guard instance.

isAuthorized(address,bytes4).notice: isAuthorized will return `true` if `_src` address can call the function with the `_sig` function selector in the current context (in this contract).

setGuard(address).notice: setGuard will set the new Guard instance. The caller must have permissions to call this function in the current Guard instance.

userdoc.notice: AuthChecker performs authorization checks on function calls. Authorization checks are returned as the result of `canCall` of the configured Guard implementation.
